text: Great price for order decent pencils although I'm a pencil snob. I purchased these for my children's classrooms, and the students will likely use them up quickly, bite the end off in day one, and never notice any small flaws.The erasers are a bit wobbly compared to my favorite brand pencil. This may cause the eraser to break off with young students vigorous erasing. They also don't sharpen quite as smoothly in the electric sharpener. My picture shows the Amazon pencil on the right with more of a rough cut wood. The Ticonderoga is the left pencil which sharpens easier. Lastly, I had to press the pencil slightly harder in paper than my favorite pencil to get the same look. However, these Amazon pencils are way better than most other store pencils and better than all dollar store pencils.
As a teacher I need pencils to last, the first pencil I sharpened went down to less than half. It’s less than half and still it’s not sharp—it broke again.

I got these pre-sharpened pencils for convenience, because 50% of my kids don’t bring pencils, and waiting for them all to sharpen new pencils is excruciating. The pencils are great for that. However, when they get dull and I attempt to sharpen them (in a hand-crank sharpener—my electric one broke earlier this year) they do that infuriating thing where the lead breaks/falls out and the wooden part sharpens at an angle, over and over. Super frustrating.

I was so excited to buy these for my classroom, but I would never do it again.  They will not sharpen in the wall mounted hand cranked sharpener, which is what the students typically use. It just chews them up. Even when I use my heavy duty electric sharpener there are problems, mostly because you often get sharp wood but no lead because it is off-centered. I am so disappointed. I was trying to make my life easier, but these definitely didn’t help!

These are not great.  The lead breaks constantly.  I always check the lead before giving it to a student--it would break.  I'd sharpen again.  Another broken lead... I'd finally get the lead to not break when I tested it, but the student would be back again minutes later with broken lead.  Now I have 150 pencils that are not useful for the classroom.  So frustrating!

These pencils are hard to sharpen, they break easy, and they will sharpen un-even. Quality is below average! The price is too much for the quality of these pencils. I definitely don't recommend these to no one. A total waste of money, save your cash and buy another brand!

These are the worst pencils I have ever seen! My kids have been complaining about them for a while, but I thought they just wanted something 'fancy' until I tried them myself.You can't sharpen these pencils. The lead is in mini pieces inside the wood casing so every time you sharpen a little, a piece of lead falls out so you have to sharpen some more. And then you just keep sharpening until there's no pencil left. I got wiser and just throw them out once the initial point gets worn down.Also, the erasers are worthless! Well, yeah, they erase, but only if they stay ON THE PENCIL!! Unfortunately, they're so flimsy that they break off when you try to erase!!

These pencils are just ok. They are rather light weight, which isn't horrible,  but it makes them feel like a lower quality.The paint of many of them is cracked. I know that is kind of a little thing, but again, it makes them feel low quality.They look a little dirty. I'm not sure if it's because they are pre-sharpened, and it's pencil lead that was loose from shipping, or if it's from the machine they are sharpened with.Ok, that was the negatives, on to the positives. The price point is good. You get more pencils for less than you will pay for other brands such as Ticonderoga or Dixon. Our schools always need pencils, so these will go to add to their resource room where I'm sure they will be used.

I'm very impressed with these pencils. Being a Math teacher we go through a lot of pencils. On a side note I'm a true pencil snob.... love my Ticonderoga pencils keeping those pencils for testing only. Definitely buying more Amazon pencils and the eraser is not bad at all. It erased completely didn't leave that annoying smudge.

Read some reviews about these pencils and learned there are some finicky people out there about a simple product.  These are a box of #2 pencils that come pre-sharpened and do everything you'd expect a pencil to do.  You know...like write, erase, get waggled back and forth between your thumb & forefinger, have that "rubber pencil" trick thing done to them that every kid does.  I haven't found ANY of the problems mentioned in other reviews.  They re-sharpen great, last a while, taste decent when you bite into them as you're deep in thought and are a CRAZY good deal at this price.  Looking for a box of straight ahead, solid, user friendly pencils at a GREAT price?  Add these to your cart, move on and don't worry about reviews by picky pencil people.
As a classroom teacher, I can attest this deal cannot be beaten. The best part is they are already sharpened so no annoying pencil sharpener noise to get them ready.

Finally got around to opening this box of pencils and they are honestly one of the worst pencils ever. They look great and write well but as soon as the tip breaks, they don’t sharpen great. And I’ve tried several different sharpeners so I know it’s the pencil. It’s really a shame because o have a whole box of unused pencils that really only have use until the tip breaks

These pencils SUCK!!!!!! I'm writing a story and need a good, sharp, even pencil.  By The time I get a sharp, viable point on both sides, the pencil is down to a nub. You can only write about one sentence (and it better be short) before you have to sharpen it again. I would suggest you spend a little extra and buy the good brand. Don't buy these! I'd send them back if I could!  I also have a very good sharpener so that's not the problem.

I bought these because I wanted to make sure that my high school math students never had the excuse that they did not have a pencil. I wanted the pre-sharpened, so I could easily pull one out and not get an excuse that it wasn't sharpened.I keep some in a basket that is in the back of my classroom. I keep the reserve in my filing cabinet. There have been many times where I am teaching, notice a kid not writing, seamlessly go to my cabinet, grab a pencil and give it to the student.I will be ordering more, so my stock will never run out. It is just sad that I have to buy these myself because (a) the kids don't have them and (b) I can't get them from my school. :(
Just opened the box all of the pencils look great! All of them are sharpened as expected! Tried one out they work like a pencil should!

I bought these for my kids ages 7 yrs, 4 yrs, 2 yrs, and 1yr.As other reviews said, there is a gap in the eraser ring, but I wiggled it around and pulled a bit on it and everything stayed in place. The kids have been using them today (they erase a lot) and we haven't had any problems. Erasers work great.They are durable even against the being banged on the table and excitedly smashed against paper to draw/write.I sharpened a few with my electric sharpener and it worked well, no breaking lead or other problems.

I’m a high school English teacher. If there is one constant in the universe, it’s that teens never come to class prepared. I tend to supply a lot of pencils so students will actually do their work, but I run through them quickly. I’ve bought a lot of inexpensive pencils and many don’t sharpen very well in the basic Boston sharpener that schools use. These seem to sharpen as well as most quality pencils... so none have been ground down by an overzealous kid and thrown in the trash.

My kids finally started using these pencils 2 weeks ago, and the eraser keep falling off. I thought the kids were breaking them. I checked them myself and the erasers are all loose, they come right off on there own.I usually love everything I get at Amazon but these pencils are the worst product I have purchased.

These are great for my grade school kids. They are presharpened saving me tons of time come early September when we're fill pencil boxes for back to school. I don't even think a single pencil tip was broken upon arrival. The erasers work decent though I tend to give my kids pencil caps to use anyway. This box of 150 should last me 2 or 3 school years if not more. I purchased a second box to donate to one of my children's teachers and they were extremely appreciative.

I don't know what type of pencil sharpener they are using but these can hardly be called pre-sharpened.  The points are flat and have like 1/32" tip that goes away after first use.  I'll end up having to buy a sharpener and resharpen these.  Otherwise they seem like any other pencil.
Bought these pencils for my first grade classroom. As much as 6 & 7yr olds firmly press down while they write, they have lasted a long time.

I am always, so far, happy with any Amazon Basics purchases I have made. This is no exception to that.I gave two of my children dozens of these when school started, and probably will still have a lot of them when school starts again next August. The beauty of these is that they are already sharpened, and they store in their box perfectly.

Good pencils- all of them came sharpened with a nice point. Perfect gift for teachers or for parents with school-aged children. Saves a bit of time and sanity since these are pre-sharpened!Update: Just wanted to add that these pencils lasted a long time. They don’t break easily and the erasers don’t get hard/unusable even after being placed in storage for a while.

These pencils will not sharpen properly.  Most of the time the lead breaks off. I have tried two different pencil sharpeners and it's the same with both of them.  My recommendation is to spend a bit more and get pencils that are functional.

Got these for the kids I teach to use during testing.  For the $ It was a good value for the quantity you get.  They were light weight and average in thickness. It comes already Sharpened which was good.  It didn’t feel that sturdy or solid to me. Some of the pencils I used already or the students used did the job but some students they tend to push down on theirs to hard and end up braking the tip.  Resharpening the pencils was just ok also.  It didn’t feel solid and some of the lead actually was looser and you could remove it which wasn’t good !  The eraser worked pretty good I can say.  It’s a hit and miss with these.  Good thing was you get a lot of pencils to go thru and hopefully they are not all the same.  So you’ll find good ones in the pack eventually on a good note !

Really fantastic product for the price I need 30 pencils for under five bucks can't beat that and they work just like them they are amazing they're sturdy they don't feel like they're going to snap whenever you're riding or if he tries to bend them just because it's amazonbasics friend does not make it any cheaper it's just as sturdy as any other brand that she would get out of the store awesome product

Purchased these for my classroom thinking I was getting a wonderful deal, especially since they are already sharpened. We've had nothing but problems since. Every pencil I've sharpened breaks almost immediately. It's like the lead is broken inside the pencils or something. In a week, we've probably gone through 60 pencils, sharpened down to a nub. I'll stick with Ticonderoga!
The lead in the pencils I received were not in the center, so when I sharpen them with a pencil sharpener, I get a wood tip instead of a lead tip. 🙁

These sticks are awesome! I bought them for my boys to use as daggers since they are already sharpened. As one of them went to slash the wall, it left a gray streak as if to say, "Ace was here" Later we realized that the sharp end would also leave the same grey streak on all types of cardboard, wood, paper and canvas. Awesome product, I know, but I am about to blow your mind. While my kids were using the pink end made for rub burns they found out that if you rub it against the gray streaks, they magically DISAPPEAR! I know this is crazy! It's like a box of 150 little stabbing time machines! I can't wait to buy more when my homeschoolers run out of these.

I bought these as they seemed to be a great deal. They came pre-sharpened, which seemed great at the start. The pre-sharpened ends, are dull bulbs and when you try to sharpen the pencil, the graphite breaks almost every time! It's so delicate that if you're lucky enough to get the pencil sharpened without breaking, you are left with a 3 inch pencil, on the FIRST SHARPENING! I would NOT recommend these pencils unless you are buying them for someone you hate!

If you are looking for pencils,look no further! This is what you need!One will last your students all year!You have many kids in your family?All you need to buy is one and it will last you the whole year!This is also an Excellent gift for any teacher! It will help your childs class out greatly! Thesr pencils are presharpened,So there is no need to worry about sharpening your childs pencils before school. This will make sure your student doesn't have to worry about sharpening their pencil before class. If your child brakes their point, they will have a back-up that is already sharpened! Which makes their life easier and that means they can focus on their work and not worry about sharpening their pencil.This is a must have for all teachers!Teachers spend money out of their pockets to buy things like pencils, paper, etc. For their students, so it would be a great idea to buy an extra one to send to school for your students teacher. It would help out a great deal!This is an Awesome Teachers gift forAny and all Teachers!!!

Been buying these boxes of pencils for the past year or so. We are now on our third box (yeah, that's what happens when our teen boys fail to put their pencils back in their backpack or pencil bag in their binder! Really, it's not hard, but they have yet to reach this developmental milestone). Thus, I love buying Amazon's bulk pencils.So glad these now come pre-sharpened! That little meaningful improvement cuts 30 seconds of pencil sharpening stress as we are trying to run out the door in the morning and someone realizes they don't have any pencils on hand. I put a bunch of these pre-sharpened beauties in a large clear mason jar, near where they store their backpacks. No excuses for being without a writing utensil!Back to my point... these are high quality pencils and an excellent value. Way to go, Amazon, for keeping our whole family stocked with quality school supplies like these pencils.

of all the things to cut corners on, you cut corners on your pencils?? these pencils are terrible. they are nearly impossible to sharpen, the tip breaks off over and over and over. after the initial pre sharpened point is gone they are basically worthless. what a waste of material. this is why our planet is in the gutter, because garbage companies make garbage products just to scam us out of our hard earned money and where do these products go? the trash. landfills. DO NOT BUY THESE PENCILS!! splurge on ticonderoga or another pencil brand that will actually sharpen.

These are very well made pencils at a very good price, 8 cents a piece.  We have bought these multiple times now with no complaints.We buy these for our kids schools and send them a hand full (50 ish) at a time.  The teacher have really appreciated the fact they are pre sharpened and we send more in mid year.I know I wrote this above but these are really well made.  Solid wood #2 pencils... not the crappy ones with some wood like product in the center around the lead.

I thought it'd be an excellent idea to get these for a teacher friend.  She always says that students lose pencils and are always asking if she has one.  So For a cheap price you can get 150 #2s.  For starters, the erasers on these are very cheap.  Some will even fall off after a couple uses.  The pencils sharpen easily - which is a bonus, but then it eats up most of the pencil in the sharpening process.  Not a fan.  I'd rather spend a bit more to get a better quality pencil.

these pencils are good quality and the erasers aren't that bad. I like that they are presharpened so I was able to use them right out of the box. I haven't had to resharpen of them as of yet. Got these mainly to replace pencils in my drawing kit that were too small or didn't want to sharpen any more. Thank you amazon for an awesome product and keep up the food work.Also as a side note the way they shipped they put a little piece of Styrofoam stuff to keep the tips from breaking thought that was a cool addition to safety of the product while it ships.

The price seemed like a bargain. I'm using these to include in pencil pouches with school supplies for Operation Christmas Child. You can see examples of school supplies and pencil pouches at blessingsinashoebox.com. I always include pencil sharpeners but I like that the pencils are pre-sharpened because the receiving children can use them right away and it make resharpening easier. They seem consistent and as wooden pencils they are fine. I would have given a higher rating but I only received 130 pencils not 150 as stated. I'm going to keep them and use them because I think the quality is decent and for 20 pencils it isn't worth the hassle of returning them for a replacement but I'll probably go back to buying the other brand before. The price is still good for 130 pencils and more importantly including them in OCC shoeboxes will offer children opportunities that they would otherwise not have. .

Great number 2 pencils. I got this for my kids for the upcoming school year and am very satisfied with my purchase. All the pencils come sharpened and the erasers work perfectly leaving no residue behind. I like the cardboard box it comes in where all the pencils are loose inside so no need to be opening several smaller packs and having all that extra cardboard. Will buy again.

Used in my woodshop for marking ends, etc.  I DO NOT PRESS HARD, yet, I have to have the entire box present because I almost go through a pencil tip every time I use the pencil..  I have never had that happen before... I have, in fact, a pencil that is at least two years old.... still holding up... and it is also rated "2h", which is what most carpenters want or use.  I advise against purchase... there are name brand pencils out there that will do the job.

I purchased these to donate to our church "Back to School Backpack" drive.  They're pre-sharpened and just what you expect from an ordinary pencil, with a few drawbacks.LENGTH:  The length of each pencil was consistent.ERASERS: The erasers aren't the best and are a bit "wobbly".  As well, they don't erase cleanly.  They leave a pink residue behind.  I don't like that.LEAD/SHARPENING: If you sharpen, sometimes the lead falls out.  Also, some of the pencils just keep sharpening down lower and lower.  You start with a new pencil and end up with half the pencil on one sharpening.  This doesn't happen with all the pencils, but it happens enough to be frustrating.VALUE:  The price is great.  However, I won't be buying again.  They just don't last long enough.

I have bought both the sharpened and unsharpened Amazon pencils.  They are both great, standard #2 pencils.  The price does fluctuate a with the sharpened ones a bit.  I looked at them before and first bought the unsharpened ones since they were a fair bit less.  When I bought the 150 sharpened ones at the beginning of the month, they were 9.99 dollars, but I've seen the price go up and down, currently 12.49 dollars.  I notice the list price for the 144 sharpened ones is 9.99, though currently there's a deal for them.Great pencils for school and home.

These are okay for the price, but definitely not great. In some of the pencils the lead is off center.Edit: Originally, I gave these 4 stars with the orginal review above. However, the more we use them the more I hate them. So often the lead is off center, which causes the lead to break easily. The kids are constantly having to stop their assignments and get up to sharpen their penicils. It is so distracting.  We still have a lot of these left, but they will be going in the trash and I will happily pay more for quality pencils.

Having two kids in school, requires a lot of pencils... so I was very excited to stumble upon this amazing deal! I added a little motivational phrase to each one and then decided to order another box for the rest of the school.Perfectly sharpened.Good eraser.Lightweight.Sharpens easily.

I bought these for my classroom.  The erasers fell off so soon that I had a bin of pencils with no erasers.  The lead is horrible.  It broke as I was sharpening them and had to throw most of them away.  Don't waste your money.

Honestly... at this point... I'm just writing reviews trying to stay awake... waiting for my husband to come home...these are pencils. Wood...and the black thing that writes. It does that erasing too. Good for school. My son uses them. They are a lot. As far as I can remember...they don't dobthat stupid crack thing every time we sharpen them so that's good.

Lead is not exactly in the center of a pencil. My kid could not write well with it because the lead is half covered by the thin wood so he kept sharpening and made the pencil really short... wood is hard and thick, and eraser works great but the QC is not that good I suppose.

The dream of every elementary teacher is to have kids come to class with a sharp pencil.  Teachers: buy a box of these econimical sharpened pencils and forget the frustration about having to deal with pencilless kids.  Better yet...get the parents to by a box for you.......even better yet....get that wonderful Principal to buy a box for every teacher at the beginning of school.  Note to Principals.....do this and you will be loved by all!

I bought these to use in my classroom. Thought I was getting a great deal. These break easily and do not sharpen well. My students would find the Amazon Basics pencils and not want to use them, because they knew they would break. Not sure if this was just a bad batch, but will not purchase again.

I bought these for my classroom - great price, right?  Pre-sharpened - AWESOME!  PROBLEM:  The tips keep falling off as the lead in all pencils is broken.  We kept sharpening them in my electric pencil sharpener only to have the SAME issue. I even tried other sharpeners thinking my previously awesome sharpener could be the culprit...NOPE.  TOTAL waste of money; ended up throwing them away.
Every time I sharpen these pencils the tips break off.

My son needed some Number 2 pencils for school and I wanted some extras for around the house. The remainder I'm donating to his class. The quantity of pencils is great for the price. And not having to sharpen them is an added bonus since I'm so tired of the cute pencils constantly breaking lead.

It's a good thIng these are pre sharpened, because good luck sharpening them yourself. The leads just fall out in inch-long segments. What is the point of having a pencil that long if you can only use it until the original tip wears down? How hard is it to make a pencil?'

I teach 1st grade and I hate sharpening 200 pencils at the beginning of the school year so I figured I would give these a try. I give each one of my kiddos 8 pencils in a pencil box at the beginning of the week. If they take care of them and turn in all 8 the following week to be sharpened they recieve a small reward plus 8 newly sharpened pencils. These pencils were a great start but when I went to sharpen them the lead continously broke while sharpening. After more than half of them doing this I got frustrated and threw the rest away instead of sharpening them. I will never buy these again! Don't waste your money to just use until the 1st time of you sharpen them.

I am a high school teacher, so I like to have pencils on hand to loan out to students.  These pre-sharpened pencils make it easy to hand to a student for them to get right to work.  They sharpen decently in my electric sharpener.  For the price, I was not expecting perfect high quality pencils.  I wanted a basic pencil with a functional eraser and that is exactly what I got.  If I wanted a high end pencil for my own use, I wouldn't bother (nor would I need a 150 pack).

Not really sure what "sheerness" indicates on a rating scale for a pencil, but sheerness is the problem.  These are nice enough pencils, good erasers, take a sharp point.  The problem is that the lead doesn't write dark enough.  I've compared these to other pencils that I own and there is a distinct difference. The writing is so light-colored that it becomes difficult to read especially when using yellow legal pads and white isn't much better. Do not recommend, find another vendor.

I bought the pencils for my daughter’s class, because teacher sent notes said they were short supply of pencils. It is a good price for the quantity. My daughter took most of the pencils to her class, and we only kept 10 of them at home. It is easy to sharpen. I used the pencils to write words with my daughter, and I usually use the regular eraser to erase. I feel it is cleaner when I use regular eraser.

I bought this for my son for back to school.  I pulled out the 24 pencils he needed then sent the other 100 pencils to his teacher for class use.  He was thrilled when I told him the cost plus that they were all sharpened.I will buy this every single year for the teachers.

I hate these pencils with the white hot intensity of a thousand burning suns.  It seems that all the lead cores are shattered, so while sharpening the tips just break off, chewing though a good portion of the pencil to get to a section that isn't broken.  Then while writing they break off again.  The worst pencils ever made.

My son has a bad habit of snapping pencils in half or chewing on them. This has caused his teachers to constantly contact me to inform he needs more pencils. The large amount of pencils in this box is so worth the price! Thanks to buying this I dont have to worry about anymore messages from the school asking for pencils to be sent in.If you have a pencil breaking little monster like I do this box will make your life easier.

I bought these to use in my second grade classroom to make sure I never run out of pencils. The problem is that in a standard pencil sharpener they frequently do not sharpen correctly and the points break off easily. The children cannot sharpen these themselves. I will not be buying them again. I will stick with Ticonderoga brand. Sorry Amazon!

You get a whole lot of pencils, number 2 already sharpened. If you have a few grandchildren the box can be divided it up. there are 150 pencils so there are a lot of pencils. They'll never run out. Make sure you have a sharpener too.

Are you too lazy to sharpen your pencil from start, these come pre-sharpened so they are ready out of the bag/box. Cheap easy to use, the erasers are ok, I would recommend buying a separate stand-alone eraser so that your don't ruin your paper.

This product sounded like a great idea.  However, the quality of the pencils are so poor.  My high school students complain about how easily the pencils literally break in half and how the lead keeps breaking when you try to sharpen the pencil.  I will not buy this again.  Didn't even use half the box before I just caved and went to Staples to buy Ticonderoga pencils.
If you are looking for good wooden pencils don't buy these.  The lead in many of the pencils is not straight and in the middle thus they sharpen poorly leaving wood over halfway up the point.
So badBroke in secondCan't sharp itJust breaksLow quality

These are pencils, not really much to say. The lead/graphite does not break easily after sharpening, eraser ends do not fall off,  The paint coating, ow whatever it is, is thick and there are no splinters. The wood material is not that plastic wood type, but appears to be a real wood, or at least the texture of a real wood. No complaints here.

As a teacher,  I need presharpened pencils. I can't have ten kids in line trying to sharpen pencils and avoid work.  The Amazon basics are ok, but the points could be better. They don't resharpen too easily. Why can't Amazon offer better prices for teachers who have $0 budget and use their own money?

My kids are all in elementary school. I used to purchase Ticonderoga #2 pencils for them. But they always go through the pencils like eating them, so I want to try some other brand which is cheaper and durable. I choose Amazon one, which is not disappointed me. They have good writing ability and are sharpen well. They sharpen quite as smoothly as in the electric sharpener. The only concern is eraser. Some erasers loose and break easily, which make it not erase completely. My kids used the eraser on different types of paper and it did not erase well. I hope this review can help others to find a good product.

These pre-sharpened pencils were gifts for my children's teachers as well as a box for my own classroom. They are not quite as good as those expensive ones, but they are presharpened and fairly durable. The only real complaint is that they tend not to sharpen straight, so you get a weird sharp point on only half of one side occasionally.
9 out of 10 pencils have broken leads. I mean, the lead inside the wood is broken into pieces! I'll never buy again and definitely don't recommend to anyone!
VERY GOOD value for the money.  Its wonderful to have pencil sharpened to start.  After using 5 of the pencils the lead breaks inside the wood and you loose 1/2 inch to resharpen it
Wonderful pencils out of the box but I cannot get them to sharpen after trying with multiple pencils and multiple sharpeners.

Unfortunately, these pencils did not hold up in my classroom. On the first day, my students would come to me with the lead immediately breaking. The eraser part doesn't not hold up well. The deal was too good to be true. Currently ordering a pack of Ticonderoga pencils for my classroom.

This review is for the AmazonBasics Pre-sharpened Wood Cased #2 HB Pencils, 150 Pack.Last year's pack included a gross of pencils, so they have added six more since last year.  They are all pre-sharpened, so you don't lose any bit of the pencil when you start using them.The price is so much better than anyone else.  If you need a bunch of pencils, I highly recommend these.
This pencil isn't dark enough even though its a #2. I bought Ticonderoga pencils which has a softer and darker lead and is  much easier to read.

These are some of the worst pencils I’ve ever seen. I would not recommend them! I bought them because of kids staying home and doing school. They are a waste of money when it comes to durability. The erasers come off so easily and it takes forever to sharpen. The lead just kept breaking off. Not a safe or friendly pencil.

At first, I thought these were fantastic and then we tried sharpening them and I ended up with stubs. My kindergarten students will use a box of pencils in one month. It was painful to throw away all these  pencils just because the lead needed sharpening.

The pencils break easily and are very cheaply made. You may as well buy pencils from the Dollar Tree, they work just as good. They came barely sharpened as well so it wasn't worth paying extra to get the pre-sharpened box. I had many lose erasers while being used too in my class. I usually love Amazon Basic products but was very unhappy with this order. I'll stick to my big boxes of unsharpened Ticonderoga pencils from Costco. Signed, a disappointed teacher.

My granddaughter’s first grade teacher asked each student to bring 48 pencils as student supplies. Evidentially now students are being asked to make up for their classmates poverty as excessive amounts of crayons were also on the list.  I just donated the whole box. Call me retro but I've yet to find a device I feel as free to express ideas with as a pencil and paper. HBs are mid-scale on the hardness/softness scale and good general use pencils - if I'm drawing or marking darker surfaces I'll use something softer.I prefer to sharpen my own: the pre-cut on these has a shorter tip and sharper angle than I get with either my hand crank or electric sharpeners. When I was a kid the house we bought even had one of those crank style pencil sharpeners that was in every school room.  You can still buy those crank style although they are cheaper made and don't do as good of job as they used too.  I'm actually surprised that they still sell them and for that matter pencils as well.  With electronic tablets, and there fancy ways of writing things down, the old pencil with an eraser seems very old fashioned, e would have expected it to go the way of mechanical pencils at least by now.  These are the same quality you used to get back in my school days.  HB is a very soft lead that takes little pressure to write or print darkly. When I worked in an engineering technician design group the drafting leads we used were 4H, 2H and HB most frequently, with HB the one for the darkest border lines.  It was difficult to use in a mechanical pencil as the thin leads broke frequently because of how soft they are.  So we used thicker versions in lead holders and sharpened with a special lead pointer or the old style way with a sand paper stick.These don't break quite as easy as the thin mechanicals because it's a thicker lead encased in the wood covering.  You don't want to erase a lot because the dark soft lead tends to smear, but if you have the right touch you can use these to draw, print, write without much problems.  One of the few pencils that you can sketch with and create different intensities of pencil shade.  4H and higher make that difficult because even if you press hard you don't get dark the leads are so hard.  Perfect for a business, or just to have a lot of writing instruments around the house, and since pencil sharpeners are not has handy as they once were in every kids pencil box, pre-sharpened is the way to do, you will need to sharpen with a sharpener if you use them frequently though.  I've sharpened pencils with a knife in the past, but with HB it's darn near impossible without breaking the lead.  Recommended for those who still use pencils for school, or just jotting down notes at home.

   Circa 2 anni fa ho comprato il pacco di matite amazonbasics non temperate da 96 pezzi. Le abbiamo finite quasi tutte e considerato il consumo di matite che abbiamo in casa tra scuole, cruciverba e papà che ne usa una nuova quasi ogni volta che fa un lavoro murato o con il legno, ho deciso di provare queste "nuove" matite di Amazon. La differenza principale è che sono già temperate, ed ho avuto l'impressione che questo ne allunghi la vita. Il legno sembra rimasto lo stesso, non una qualità altissima, non legno di cedro puro e profumato, ma un legno comunque con cui non ho mai avuto problemi in due anni. Tra le foto ne ho aggiunta una in cui è possibile confrontare i tratti di diverse anche di matite. Queste amazonbasics, come le vecchie non temperate, hanno un tratto abbastanza marcato. Anche la gommina è rimasta la stessa, di qualità discreta, fa bene il suo lavoro. Per 0,1011 €/pezzo ( al mio acquisto, 15,17€ la scatola da 150 ) è in assoluto la confezione di matite più economica che io abbia trovato su Amazon, e sono delle buone matite.Mi rattrista un po' che il colore di queste già pretemperate sia un po' più spento di quello che già avevo prima ma diciamocelo, nonostante anche l'occhio voglia la sua parte, il colore non è un elemento essenziale. In più non è che sia brutto, è solo un pochino più scuro.AGGIORNAMENTO 31 agosto 2020 (un altro anno accademico sta per iniziare...)E noi non abbiamo ancora finito il pacco da 150, per fortuna. Voglio aggiungere questo pezzo perché con un anno in più di utilizzo di queste matite, io non ne ho ancora trovata una rotta ed inutilizzabile. Volevo quindi stressare quanto io mi stia trovando bene con le matite Amazonbasics. Ho aggiunto una foto di uno schemino veloce che avevo fatto mentre studiavo, scritto con queste matite. Ho aggiunto anche un video in cui calcando un po’ faccio uno scarabocchio e poi cerco di far sbavare la matita. Si vede per bene che la matita le prime volte che ci passo, non sbava. Sbava solo passando il pollice con più forza. Poi ho cancellato il ghirigoro per mostrare il funzionamento della gomma; si vede che non è una cancellazione perfettissima, ma la ritengo decisamente sufficiente per chiunque non stia facendo il disegno del progetto di uno shuttle spaziale (anche negli appunti ci sono dele cancellature, sfido a trovarle!).
